attributes.action: MP's that sleep in the House of Commons  to face sanctions and docked pay.
attributes.additional_details:
In any private sector work place there would be repercussions any many would be fired for such gross misconduct or face financial sanctions.

Parliament should lead by example. You wouldn't expect the job centre to let someone to fall asleep on the job without repercussions.  They would incur a 2 week (minimum) sanction.

MP for Beckenham, Bob Stewart, slept during a debate on cutting £30 ESA for the most vulnerable in society yet woke up to pass vote.  He was caught on the cameras live.
attributes.background:
Elected MP's, paid for by the British public,  are failing to perform their elected duties by sleeping on the job. 

Therefore this is a call for any MP caught sleeping to be sanctioned and loose 2 weeks pay, like at the job centres.
